newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai Stock Exchange closed for lunar holiday.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Stock Exchange closed for lunar holiday.

text.p: The Shanghai Stock Exchange will close for two weeks starting Monday over the Chinese Lunar New Year holiday, an exchange statement said on Friday.
Trading will resume on February 17, it said.
On Friday, Shanghai's B share index closed up 1.62 percent to 66.849 points. The A share index ended up 0.44 percent to 1,006.362 points.
